instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 semi-dead
threads.message:
This board is similar to the one in the other post but it has different current measurements. It also turned off and did not turn on again

first I had a short in <CAPACITOR>C7900</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7901</CAPACITOR>. I have removed both capacitors and now there is no short and I can measure <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.5v but it still won't turn on. If I try to connect the charger with the battery, the battery symbol appears in red but the fan does not turn and does not turn on.

is it necessary to replace the capacitors to test? or can it be tested without closing the circuit?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
PP3V42 G3H REG 3.39v
PP5V S4 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>P5VS4_ES</SIGNAL> 0v
PM SLP S5 L 0v
S5 PwrGd 3.36v
(<SIGNAL>P5VP3V3_VREF2</SIGNAL>) 1,96v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 semi-dead
threads.message:
This machine starts without fan sign; it will spin when CPU gets really hot.

Test the board alone on the desk, only charger connected; NO trackpad, nor keyboard.
Just check CPU core voltage (L7310/20).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 semi-dead
threads.message:
very very thanks 

used your advice above and with an original magesafe2 charger it works.

I used original magesafe1 charger with original adapter to 2
